story.title: âœ¨ A long time ago in a far, far away 2019 ...
story.description: My journey into the world of frontend development began in 2019. While studying at university, I became interested in web development. At first, I set myself a simple goal: to create a simple website about my favorite topic, Lo-Fi music. But at some point I discovered React and wanted to make a full-fledged SPA, and that's when it all started.

Evraz.stack: TypeScript, React, Redux Toolkit, Effector, Apollo + GraphQL, WebSocket, Vite, Webpack, Storybook, Yup, Echarts
Evraz.projects: Worked in a team of 41+ people on digitalization projects for manufacturing. Development was done using Scrum and Github Flow, tasks were managed in Microsoft Azure.
Evraz.achievements:
Developed a service from scratch for issuing QR codes to employees for access to special zones in production.

Created an MVP for keeping a report journal for blast furnace operations together with analysts. Implemented a mock server on Node.js and Excel report export.

Wrote 27+ components for the internal UI-Kit: from 'smart' buttons to dynamic tables. This allowed us to abandon Ant Design and speed up development.

Refactored a large legacy project to hooks, TypeScript, and Feature Sliced Design.

In a dashboard with 12,000+ users, replaced polling with WebSocket. As a result, server load was significantly reduced and 500 errors were eliminated.

Participated in replacing Power BI and SAP: created charts using Echarts, Apexcharts, Highcharts, Charts.js, and D3.js for custom requirements.

OneTwoTrip.stack: React, TypeScript, React Query, Webpack, React Virtualized, Styled Components, NextJs, Jest, i18next
OneTwoTrip.projects:
Worked on the part of the project related to hotel search and recommendations at OneTwoTrip.

Domain area â€” developing and improving UI for an online travel booking platform.

500,000+ users/month, worked in a team of 20+ people using Kanban.
OneTwoTrip.achievements:
Increased the share of TypeScript in the codebase, which simplified the development of new features and helped avoid many bugs.

Introduced the concept of CSS tokens together with designers, making it easier to update the color palette and collaborate between teams.

Worked with a partner bank to implement and support 3DS 2.0 protocols for payment processing.

Ensured successful PCI DSS audit by applying knowledge from the OWASP Top 10 list. Developed a Backend for Frontend on Node.js to aggregate data from different endpoints and package them into a single request.

TwoGis.stack: JavaScript, React, Redux, Redux-Thunk, Webpack, Jest, React Hook Form
TwoGis.projects: Worked in a team of 5 people on the Otello project â€” a platform for online hotel booking, participating in the development of the frontend part of the service.
TwoGis.achievements:
Created interface components using React based on the internal design system, made improvements to the project's general UI-Kit for easier development.

Integrated REST API with the backend, connecting third-party services to the project for proper function operation.

Collaborated with designers and analysts, adding animations and interactive elements to make the platform more user-friendly.

skills.experienceDescription:
Here is my commercial experience, excluding pet projects and freelance work. Of course, this is far from everything, it's just a brief summary.

After graduating from university, I started looking for a job in my city. My first company was 2GIS, where I mastered React and the basics of clean code, as well as got acquainted with the main processes.

A year later, I moved to Saint Petersburg and reopened my resume. My second company was OneTwoTrip, where I learned the basics of security, as I joined a team working with users' card data and similar things.
